title: YuginKadoya
author: YuginKadoya
created_time: June 30, 2022, 03:23:54 PMLast edit: May 21, 2023, 03:05:31 PM by YuginKadoya
content: 2023 WNBA Talk and BetI haven't seen any thread here so I made one, well I think there are not many who wants to discuss the woman's NBA but it is worth the shot, and I just try to make it simple, and because we don't have any event or games on the NBA yet, I decided to make a thread for the discussion on the WNBA, I know this is already late, and the games are already started, but it is better to be late than never, Eastern Conference Chicago Sky Connecticut SunWashington MysticsNew York LibertyAtlanta DreamIndiana FeverWestern ConferenceLas Vegas AcesSeattle StormDallas WingsPhoenix MecuryLos Angeles SparksMinnesota Links

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Looks like the Biden administration might finally be bringing Brittany Griner home. Theyâ€™re going to have to trade a convicted arms dealer serving a 25 year sentence for Griner, who once physically assaulted her wife and is now jailed in Russia for being caught with a controlled substance. This will no doubt be celebrated by the WNBA.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: YuginKadoya on June 30, 2022, 03:23:54 PMI haven't seen any thread here so I made one, well I think there are not many who wants to discuss the woman's NBA but it is worth the shot,That's probably because nobody or less than 1% of the sports bettors in this forum gamble on their games. WNBA are not generating enough revenue year on year to sustain the operations and the last time I read anything significant about them was that they're able to raise millions early this year for a business model revamp.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on July 27, 2022, 10:25:34 PMQuote from: YuginKadoya on June 30, 2022, 03:23:54 PMI haven't seen any thread here so I made one, well I think there are not many who wants to discuss the woman's NBA but it is worth the shot,That's probably because nobody or less than 1% of the sports bettors in this forum gamble on their games. WNBA are not generating enough revenue year on year to sustain the operations and the last time I read anything significant about them was that they're able to raise millions early this year for a business model revamp.As Bill Burr said so eloquently, the WNBA has been failed by women. Women arenâ€™t supporting womenâ€™s sports the way men (or women) support menâ€™s sports. This leads to a major difference in revenue and thus salaries for players. If women supported womenâ€™s sports more, maybe networks would start making a bigger deal about their games and people might eventually take an interest.

comments.author: btc_angela
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on July 27, 2022, 10:25:34 PMQuote from: YuginKadoya on June 30, 2022, 03:23:54 PMI haven't seen any thread here so I made one, well I think there are not many who wants to discuss the woman's NBA but it is worth the shot,That's probably because nobody or less than 1% of the sports bettors in this forum gamble on their games. WNBA are not generating enough revenue year on year to sustain the operations and the last time I read anything significant about them was that they're able to raise millions early this year for a business model revamp.Actually I have been betting in the last couple of days.But let me tell you something, it's really hard to predict the outcome of the game, lol. So I temporarily stop this 2 days because my record is not that good, (maybe 3 out 10)So I have stir up, but the game is there, excitement, thrash talking. But the again, NBA is really very different.Dream vs Lynx - won't even predict, as this is going to be very tough game.

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: I think Ronda Rousey showed any female sport can blow up in popularity. They only need an athlete who can be a star to bring excitement and attention to the game. People want to see greatness. On some level, it makes them feel great. Watching WNBA is more like watching unmotivated employees show up to a 9 to 5 job than it is something likely to garner mainstream attention. There isn't much excitement or urgency people can relate to. Which could be the norm as far as woman's sports go.Even female boxing lacked good paydays until the Paul brothers began promoting Amanda Serrano. Before that happened, female boxers like Claressa Shields were transitioning to MMA due to the pay being better.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on July 27, 2022, 11:50:36 PMI think Ronda Rousey showed any female sport can blow up in popularity. They only need an athlete who can be a star to bring excitement and attention to the game. agreed, it still baffles me how some people are so eager to blame men for not being interested in women's category in sports. also, the funny thing is top athletes like Ronda Rousey knows what needs to be done in order to become high-paying athlete. if they want to be recognized by people they need to level up their game.

comments.author: Reid
comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on July 27, 2022, 11:50:36 PMI think Ronda Rousey showed any female sport can blow up in popularity. They only need an athlete who can be a star to bring excitement and attention to the game. Possibly. She went to Hollywood for a show and then Wrestling matches to gain popularity. Her agent might be good to keep track on what they will do next to up her market. I watch WNBA just to be updated with stars but not with the whole roster unlike the NBA. They badly need something that will pump their market up. It's been too long already and I still don't see any change. The worst thing is girls today which should've been supportive to them might be doing something else due to the pandemic (i.e. phones and computers) instead of liking the sport.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: I very rarely watch anything to do with the WNBA. I may hear a little local sports news about the Chicago Sky, and I think Iâ€™ve heard theyâ€™ve had relatively good success these past few years. I am curious, was Britney Griner on a team in the WNBA and just playing off-season over seas or ??

WNBA are not generating enough revenue year on year to sustain the operations and the last time I read anything significant about them was that they're able to raise millions early this year for a business model revamp.That is very sad, I really think they need to consider when I watched the WNBA, it is likely not like the regular NBA but there are certain talents that you can not miss by watching them and it was s sad that Kobe Bryant's Gianna Bryant pass on, she will be a potential future talent for the WNBA, well if they are going for a business model revamp, I really wish that there would still the same talent as the last time, Quote from: ChiBitCTy on July 28, 2022, 05:38:59 AMI very rarely watch anything to do with the WNBA. I may hear a little local sports news about the Chicago Sky, and I think Iâ€™ve heard theyâ€™ve had relatively good success these past few years. comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on July 27, 2022, 10:50:26 PMQuote from: Yogee on July 27, 2022, 10:25:34 PMQuote from: YuginKadoya on June 30, 2022, 03:23:54 PMI haven't seen any thread here so I made one, well I think there are not many who wants to discuss the woman's NBA but it is worth the shot,That's probably because nobody or less than 1% of the sports bettors in this forum gamble on their games. WNBA are not generating enough revenue year on year to sustain the operations and the last time I read anything significant about them was that they're able to raise millions early this year for a business model revamp.As Bill Burr said so eloquently, the WNBA has been failed by women. Women arenâ€™t supporting womenâ€™s sports the way men (or women) support menâ€™s sports. This leads to a major difference in revenue and thus salaries for players. If women supported womenâ€™s sports more, maybe networks would start making a bigger deal about their games and people might eventually take an interest. Yes that's one of the most common reason why the league is still struggling two decades after it was created. Talent or skills may be there as btc_angela said but I share other people's observation that it seems women are more interested in men's sports. Maybe the "Karen" supporters of WNBA demanding support from men in social media doesn't help either hehehe.Quote from: YuginKadoya on July 28, 2022, 03:28:45 PM.....That is very sad, I really think they need to consider when I watched the WNBA, it is likely not like the regular NBA but there are certain talents that you can not miss by watching themUnfortunate as it may seem but that's the reality. Some men even compare watching WNBA to buying an inferior product. They would rather choose the best out there if they're going to spend their money.

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: I'm following WNBA before and even placed bets at some games. That's the time when I'm still at hype betting on basketball after the NBA Finals and my only options are WNBA and local basketball games. But it's been a year now that I don't have any updates regarding the league.I'm glad that my favorite Becky Hammon of the New York Liberty before, was involved in NBA as an assistant coach for the San Antonio Spurs for 8 seasons if I'm not mistaken. But this year, he won't be part of the Spurs coaching staff as she now shifts to other league.Anyways, bookmarking this thread for any updates and for discussion purposes.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: I guess it's a good discussion while waiting for the regular season of the NBA. But it's a fact that there's less popular in the WNBA. I guess because of the idea that we've been stuck to the NBA and there's no gender preference issue on this.Quote from: YuginKadoya on July 28, 2022, 03:28:45 PMBrittney Griner pretty much is in prison on Russian soil, but Biden has announced that he approved a prisoner swap with Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan with Viktor Bout but there are no further details about it, Let's say the swap occurs, do you think that she'll be able to get back on track on the league?

They would rather choose the best out there if they're going to spend their money.Well, I can not blame them and I think they are used to supporting the regular NBA more than with the Woman's league, but I am just asking if we can surely give credit and importance to the woman that surely has potential to the sports of basketball, well and just like what I have said that Kobe Bryant little girl (Gigi) Gianna Byrant was inspired of this sports that she promised that she will one day play on it, well rest their souls, if Bryant is still alive I think he will surely support this in any way possible, Quote from: passwordnow on July 28, 2022, 10:23:14 PMQuote from: YuginKadoya on July 28, 2022, 03:28:45 PMBrittney Griner pretty much is in prison on Russian soil, but Biden has announced that he approved a prisoner swap with Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan with Viktor Bout but there are no further details about it, Let's say the swap occurs, do you think that she'll be able to get back on track on the league?Brittney Griner will never be the same again, all that moments lost almost 5 months, and after this incident, if she can surely play for the WNBA again, maybe she can, but I highly doubt that time that she has missed is surely a lot, and this incident I think was very traumatic for her as well, Anyway update to the WNBA right now as I am posting this, the Phoenix Mercury and Los Angeles Sparks, are having a match and they are in the 3rd Quarter of their game, having Phoenix Mercury on the advantage, having Diana Taurasi and Skylar Diggins-Smiths pumping some score for the Phoenix Mercury,

Maybe WNBA will mandatorily require athletes to be sexy and beautiful to haveÂ  more support for both men and women.In my opinion, there are different types of women with different likes and I think the adoration of a woman and another woman is not just intimacy, you can also say that some adoration because she likes how she plays and wants to play just like her, just like Jayson Tatum to Kobe Bryant, Tatum wants the mindset of Kobe and adoring him and one be like him when he plays ball, I really think WNBA doesn't need sexy and beautiful players but if there will be beautiful players that are a bonus, but just like in the NBA talent and greatness in playing basketball is what they are needing, Here are my picks for the WNBA 2022 tomorrow games Indiana Fever VS Las Vegas Aces Stake odds for this game are 7.20 for the Fever while 1.06 for the Aces, for now, there are no injuries for any teams, and Las Vegas Aces have the upper hand with the odds if they are the favorite to win, and the last game for this team it was Las Vegas Aces wins with the score of 90 - 77 a pretty much high Advantage for the Aces, and I think A'ja Wilson from the Aces will score more than 20 plus points again, While Jackie Young is on support, so my pick will be Las Vegas Aces but due to the number of odds for the Aces, Chicago Sky VS New York Liberty Stake odds for this game are 1.16 for Sky while 4.50 for Liberty, Right now for New York Liberty Betnijah Laney is said to be the only injured player, and she underwent arthroscopic surgery, On July 24, Liberty won a game against Chicago Sky with 83 - 80 Score, but for now, I think Chicago Sky will take their revenge in this game for me Chicago Sky could win this game, so Chicago Sky is my pick,

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: ^I like the picks but it ain't profitable. Spreads are -14.5 for the Aces and -10.5 for the Sky. I would just go for the +14.5 for the Indiana Fever instead.This is good. I was thinking about opening a thread about this too but I was in doubt it will get the support because most of the members here are likely to watch NBA than WNBA. Perhaps we could make some spark starting with this.

Perhaps we could make some spark starting with this.Well, actually I never bet for the Aces VS Fever match and I really don't want to risk a bet for the Indiana Fever aswell, because I think this is a sure win for the Las Vegas Aces, well I should have indicated that I didn't bet on this one, but I have bet on the 2nd game for Halftime/Fulltime, New York Liberty on the 1st half and Chicago Sky on the fulltime, 5.60 for Chicago Sky winning this game, At first, I was really hesitant in creating this thread, because there might be no people who would like a discussion for the WNBA, but I still made it, and hoped for the best, at the 1st week there are no one posting for the thread, but I think 1 or 2 more weeks have past and likely many are posting in, well not a bad idea posting this thread after all,
